jparsec.ephem.planets

Class PlanetEphem

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.ephem.planets.PlanetEphem

  • public class PlanetEphem
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for planetary and lunar ephemeris calculations, based on a fit to JPL DE404 ephemeris over the interval 3000 B.D to 3000 A.D for giant planets, and 1500 B.D. to 3000 A.D. for inner planets (including Mars). Errors are in the arcsecond level when comparing to the long time span ephemeris JPL DE406.

    This code is based on the work by Steve L. Moshier.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain), S. L. Moshier

    • Method Detail

      • getHeliocentricEclipticPositionJ2000

        public static double[] getHeliocentricEclipticPositionJ2000(double JD,
                                            Target.TARGET planet)
                                                     throws JPARSECException
        Obtain position of a planet. Rectangular heliocentric coordinates mean equinox and ecliptic J2000. For the Moon the geocentric position is returned.
        Parameters:
        JD - Time in Julian day.
        planet - Planet ID constant (From Sun to Pluto, Moon, barycenters, and libration).
        Returns:
        Array with the x, y, z results.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the calculation fails.

      • getGeocentricPosition

        public static double[] getGeocentricPosition(double JD,
                             Target.TARGET planet,
                             double light_time,
                             boolean addSat,
                             ObserverElement obs)
                                      throws JPARSECException
        Get rectangular ecliptic geocentric position of a planet in equinox J2000, and ICRF frame.
        Parameters:
        JD - Julian day in TDB.
        planet - Planet ID.
        light_time - Light time to planet in days.
        addSat - True to add the planetocentric position of the satellite to the position of the planet.
        obs - The observer object. Can be null for the Earth's center.
        Returns:
        Array with x, y, z, vx, vy, vz coordinates. Note velocity components are those for the Earth (used for aberration correction) not those for the planet relative to the geocenter.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the calculation fails.

      • MoshierEphemeris

        public static EphemElement MoshierEphemeris(TimeElement time,
                            ObserverElement obs,
                            EphemerisElement eph)
                                     throws JPARSECException
        Calculate planetary ephemeris, providing full data. This method uses Moshier's fit to JPL DE404 Ephemeris. Peak errors are below 0.5 arcsecond for planets, and below 0.1 arcseconds for the Moon, when comparing with JPL results. Typical errors are much lower. Fit is valid from 3000 B.C. to 3000 A.D. for giant planets, and from 1350 B.C. to 3000 A.D. for inner planets. To calculate approximate ephemerides of inner planets up to 3000 B.C. use VSOP87, or ELP2000 for more acurrate ephemeris for the Moon before year 1600. The Moon position will contains lunar librations computed also from Moshier's fit.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object containing the date.
        obs - Observer object containing the observer position.
        eph - Ephemeris object with the target and ephemeris properties.
        Returns:
        Ephem object containing ephemeris data. Rise, set, transit times and maximum elevation fields are not computed in this method, use Ephem class for that.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the calculation fails.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        For unit testing only.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
